discussion_comments.comment_body:
lets split this into like 6 top-level jobs next:

- `tests/browser/builtin_patchright`
- `tests/browser/user_binary`
- `tests/browser/cdp`
- `tests/models/openai`
- `tests/models/google`
- `tests/models/anthropic`

and we can keep adding more of the existing tests as jobs + implementing more in the future:

- `tests/models/deepseek`
- `tests/models/grok`
- ...
- `tests/functionality/click`
- `tests/functionality/tabs`
- `tests/functionality/input`
- ...

commented_code:
+name: Tests
+on:
+  push:
+  pull_request:
+  workflow_dispatch:
+    
+jobs:
+  tests:
+    name: ${{ matrix.test }} 
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    strategy:
+      matrix:
+        test: [browser, models, functionality, all]

discussion_comments.commented_code:
@@ -0,0 +1,43 @@

+  push:

+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

discussion_comments.comment_body:
matrix is ok for this one but do one line per test like this:

```suggestion
        test:
            - browser/patchright
            - browser/user_binary
            - browser/remote_cdp
            - models/openai
            - models/google
            - models/anthropic
            # TODO: keep adding more in the future
            # - models/azure         # (requires AZURE_OPENAI_API_KEY set)
            # - models/deepseek      # (requires DEEPSEEK_API_KEY set)
            # - models/grok          # (requires GROK_API_KEY set)
            # - functionality/click
            # - functionality/tabs
            # - functionality/input
```
Most of these don't exist yet, that's ok for now.
